definition: to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: Armed robbery and abduction have been on the increase countrywide.
sentences.chinese: 持械抢劫和诱拐案的案发率在全国范围内都有所上升。

sentences.english: He spent ten years behind bars after being convicted for armed robbery.
sentences.chinese: 在被判持械抢劫罪后，他度过了十年牢狱生活。

sentences.english: Rico was arrested by the police for armed robbery and taken to jail.
sentences.chinese: 瑞克因持械抢劫被警方逮捕入狱。

sentences.english: We noticed they used gunfire everywhere, as well as thugs with batons in many places.
sentences.chinese: 他们到处开枪，很多地方还有持械歹徒。

sentences.english: The plane was hijacked by two armed men on a flight from London to Cairo.
sentences.chinese: 班机在从伦敦飞往开罗途中遭到了两名持械男子劫持。

sentences.english: He served seven years for armed robbery.
sentences.chinese: 他因持械抢劫而服七年徒刑。

definition: to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
violent crime/to commit a violent act (assault or murder)
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
